website_summaries.verdict: The Moto G4 Plus adds a fingerprint sensor and slightly better camera to the mix, but its cheaper sibling is still the better deal.
pros: In addition to retaining its sibling's water-resistant body and full HD screen, the Moto G4 Plus adds a fingerprint sensor, slightly better camera, and you can select more storage and memory
cons: That fingerprint scanner confusingly looks like a home button, and the lack of NFC means you can't use the phone for contactless payments

customer_reviews.title: Especially Great if You Travel to Europe a Lot
customer_reviews.text: Traded in a Samsung Galaxy 4 for this, and I love it. Features galore, AND unlocked. I took it to Verizon (my US carrier) and got it activated on their network. Then on a European trip, I took it to a Three store, slid in an Irish SIM and it worked beautifully. Same in the UK. I was able to use local SIMs in the same phone and didn't even lose any of my apps. No more roaming charges.
customer_reviews.author: Ringlets

customer_reviews.title: Stay AWAY!!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm sending back my third phone for warranty replacement again. They seem to last about three months before something goes wrong. I love this phone when it works but am without a phone for more than a week at a time when sending back. Also service center is not good. The first two phones started to restart over and over. Did a factory reset, lost everything on the phone and did not help. This happened twice. My third phone is now not charging. Did all the troubleshooting, including factory reset and no luck. Samsung here I come.
customer_reviews.author: Neil E. Fox

customer_reviews.title: Was given faulty, and tamper with phone.
customer_reviews.text: Nice phone, but I was given a phone that had been tampered with, not brand new. Screen protector had been taken off, and put back on, as the bubbles showed me. I looked passed it, hoping that it was just a part of an "Unlocking" method... then as I was signing into all my accounts, the bottom left corner of the screen would randomly just press down, even when I wasn't holding the phone. It typed "N,N,,.N.N." and scrolled up and down the menus disabling me from doing anything!...I restarted the phone (after requesting a return) and it seemed to work fine for a couple hours, and it happened again. Thanks but no thanks....
customer_reviews.author: Kelly P

customer_reviews.title: Become unusable after 4 months. Waze, You tube ...
customer_reviews.text: Become unusable after 4 months. Waze, You tube, Facebook apps in full-screen and receive calls/outgoing calls make phone auto shutdown. Doesn't matter what the battery percentage is 100% or 10%. SD cart not recognized sometime (I try various speeds, brands..etc). I try all Android OS software updates. You cannot use compass apps in this phone hardware don't support. Edit> Call warranty, they provide good fast service.But, Then sent me a new phone. Now after 2 months it has same battery issue. Switch off by it self :(, Good screen, good camera, no bloated software, settings bit different but fast, used banking apps, mails, FB, all are fine utill you put them in full screen. May be i'm one unfortunate guy
customer_reviews.author: Beautyc

customer_reviews.title: Seemed great at first, but is really junk
customer_reviews.text: At the very beginning, I really liked this phone, but then it had repeated problems. I had to return it twice because the battery life diminished rapidly to the point where it wasn't even holding a charge all day with typical usage. I had to return it another time because the radio went bad, preventing me from getting a cellular signal. It crashes randomly during FB messenger and Skype video chats. The battery went bad again just 3 months after my last replacement. The warranty was up, so this last go round I replaced the battery myself. It now has a bad charging port, so I ordered a new dongle to solder on.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Laser Beam

customer_reviews.title: Fortunately, this a second phone when travelling places where ...
customer_reviews.text: Would be a decent phone if it didn't have ongoing "ghost touching" both charging and in normal use. Motorola know about the issue, but make fixing/exchanging a pain (on top of wanting to charge $24.99 for the privilege). Fortunately, this a second phone when travelling places where my normal phone (iPhone 7) is just asking to robbed, but it pity the people relying on for daily use. Motorola/Lenovo have come a long way, in the wrong direction customer service wise.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best thing I could've done.
customer_reviews.text: First off I was sceptical on this purchase but now that I have it and activated it through straight talk Verizon it works like a charm. The camera is great! I love taking photos with it! I definitely recommend it to people being as it's got a good screen size and it never lags. Definitely will buy again if ever needed. Especially if they bring out a new generation. Definitely 5 star worthy to me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great features in a higly unreliable phone
customer_reviews.text: Great start, would have been a 5 star product After a month the message "No SIM card" downgrade to 2-3 stars Received replacement from very helpful customer service. Same message with the new phone. Downgrade to 1.5 starts, rounded up to 2. Tested SIM card on an older model Moto E, worked like a charm. Here is my recommendation. If you get this phone and your first SIM card works, never ever try to get a new SIM card, the phone might never work again :(
customer_reviews.author: BobSunnyvale

customer_reviews.title: Good phone but has some serious software issues
customer_reviews.text: I've had this phone for about a year and a half and I really liked it, until recently all sound stopped working. So now alarms don't go off, I can't play music or make phone calls unless it's over Bluetooth or through headphones. As of today all media stopped working so now I can't receive videos on snapchat, or watch videos on YouTube or Facebook. As far as I can tell these are common problems that can only be fixed by replacing the motherboard. So if you don't mind replacing your phone every year then I do recommend it, but if you're like me and expect a phone to last longer then don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: An incredible bargain
customer_reviews.text: My mom bought this phone, and compared to my iPhone 6 Plus, this phone has a slightly better camera, the fingerprint sensor is much faster, the charge speed is several times faster, and the general Android performance feels about the same as my iPhone 6 Plus in iOS. This model is almost completely stock Android, which is great if you don't want many manufacturer-specific apps. It can be upgraded to Android 7 (Nougat). One small addition is a great Moto app software feature where two shakes of the phone turned sideways in a chopping motion turns the LED light on or off. It's a simple feature, but it's a slick interface. The phone is an incredible bargain overall.
customer_reviews.author: fungicord

customer_reviews.title: Screen flickering and jumping problems
customer_reviews.text: I liked this phone except for the screen flickering/jumping problem that made it virtually unusable before I even loaded one app from Playstore. For those of you not familiar with this problem, it's as if the screen takes on a life of its own, opening and closing features, taking pictures, moving icons. I tried most of the "fixes" that people reported in internet blogs, but none worked and decided to return it. I ordered a replacement phone hoping that another Moto G4 Plus from another manufacturing batch would not have the problem, but after the first day the flickering/screen jumping started on the second phone. I will be returning that one too and hunting for other option from another manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Shorebird

customer_reviews.title: It worked fine for about 15 months and suddenly random screens
customer_reviews.text: This phone has been trouble. Within weeks of getting it I got random screens, flickering, could hardly shut it off. It took a factory reset not long after getting it. It worked fine for about 15 months and suddenly random screens, press a button and something different pops up, type in a 1 one and a 3 or 6 appears, etc. Tried multiple factory resets, lasted about 15 minutes each time and then back to the same thing. I believe the digitizer is no longer functioning. Not pleased at all with the functioning of this phone.
customer_reviews.author: A. Lacy

customer_reviews.title: I'm disappointed in the camera
customer_reviews.text: Really been enjoying my phone, but there are 2 things that I would choose to improve on. 1. My phone keeps disconnecting from the internet. It is aggravating to constantly have to reconnect. I've done a little research and apparently this is a problem with many, and 2. I'm disappointed in the camera. It could have better resolution. My pictures are not as clear as I had hoped they would be. I wanted to choose a phone that took great pictures(instead of using a seperate camera) and this phone didn't fit the bill as I hoped it would. Everything else is great.
customer_reviews.author: Daddy Woot

customer_reviews.title: Lots of phone for the money
customer_reviews.text: Read all the reviews but when Clark Howard recommended the Moto G4 that sealed the deal. My wife lost most of her hearing several years ago and has had trouble hearing on the phone. I let her use the G4 and now I have to buy one for her since she was able hear clearly on mine. I've been using a Moto X for several years and I love having all the extra memory.
customer_reviews.author: Fr. John

customer_reviews.title: Continued to degrade over time
customer_reviews.text: I used to like Moto Gs Had a few and the were ok But this one, oi vey Was fine at first but within a year it kept pressing buttons on it's own and general crazyness. It kept getting worse and worse. I took the screen protector off, no case and still problems. Absolutely frustrating. I tried many things and eventually thought it could be viruses so I got Norton and still same problems. I finally did a factory reset and the problems were still there. Never buying Motorola again.
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: Love my new phone
customer_reviews.text: I have loved having this phone. It has replaced my moto e first gen, which was not working too well anymore. As far as user experience goes it has been great to have the phone actually do what I want it to do and not be crashing. The only thing that I have to complain about is the size. It is just big enough that I can't text using just one hand because my hand is not big enough to hold on to the phone while my thumb types. But everything else has been working great.
customer_reviews.author: Risa Swan

customer_reviews.title: No hiccups...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this phone primarily for the fingerprint id and was not disappointed. It works very well and adds that bit of security I was looking for. I love the screen size and the picture quality is great. I use Tracfone and purchased the byop activation kit from Amazon for an extra $1.00 and everything went smoothly with no hiccups. Lots of memory, no bloatware and a fast processor puts this one on my recommended list.
customer_reviews.author: cager

customer_reviews.title: Phone not detecting sim card
customer_reviews.text: Well my galaxy S7 screen is turning pink im going to send the phone to samsung warranty but before i send it i ordered a moto G4 plus from breed and just got it today. I was exited opened the box phone battery was completely dead. I plugged the phone when the phone had some charge i place the sim card turned on and a message pop up on the screen saying emergency calls only no sim something like that i try turning off and on the phone nothing worked. I factory reset the phone nothing worked same message like didn't even had a inserted sim card. Called amazon then breed guess wont have a phone for now :-(
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: THIS ONE SOMEHOW SLIPPED THROUGH QUALITY CONTROL
customer_reviews.text: This was an Amazon Warehouse Deal listed as "Very Good". Sadly, this unit,arrived with a damaged and non-functioning sound circuit. Neither the speaker nor phone jack produced sound. But for that, the phone was superior in its design & feel and the speed, and screen quality was excellent. The Amazon Service Rep was excellent and the device has been returned.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Stroud Dalton

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed with the company
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I had a negative experience with this product. 2 weeks after I received the phone it started glitching and doing "ghost commands". I returned the phone for repair to Motorola and received it back very quickly thinking that it was repaired. When I received the phone and tried to activate it, the phone would not accept my SIM card. No problems with SIM card, there was something actually wrong with the phone. I contacted Motorola and determined that something was wrong with the phone, however they did not offer me a new phone, but rather a "like new" phone. Very disappointed with the company.
customer_reviews.author: Estela

customer_reviews.title: Ghost Touch
customer_reviews.text: At first I was thrilled with this phone because of the price and it takes great pictures. But several months later it started the ghost touch. My phone will just start going crazy and windows will pop up and buttons will start being pushed. I have to push the side button on and off several times to get it to stop. And sometimes it will call people on it's own. One time someone got called very late and they got upset with me. I would definitely not recommend this phone!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: crane004

customer_reviews.title: Ghost Touch on 2 Phones
customer_reviews.text: Had 2 of these, both ended up with ghost touch - screen moves and clicks without actual touching. Once it was in warranty and they replaced, once it was not and they refused to stand behind their products. Avoid these phones. The description should state "will work for approximately one year". Update. Tried to escalate this to someone who cares at Motorola. They offered by 30% discount on repair. Doesn't seem right to pay another $100 for another probable defective device. I declined. When their out of office email notification for 11/22/2018 stated "The Universal Command Center is currently out of the office for the Labor Day Holiday"...well, that says it all, right?
customer_reviews.author: David L. Cohen

customer_reviews.title: i loved the phone when it worked my phone is meticulously ...
customer_reviews.text: i loved the phone when it worked my phone is meticulously perfect on the outside and its never had water or anything on it now a year later it wont function away from a battery pack and support is useless i don't want to pay $150 for a replacement refurbished phone because you put a shoddy battery pack in it if i delete all my stuff from a phone and factory reset it and it still power cycles like crazy thats factory defective not software this was my 6th motorola phone now your forcing me through your support channels to find a new phone maker... awful......shame on you
customer_reviews.author: jason

customer_reviews.title: Surprised I like it this much.
customer_reviews.text: I love this phone. It is bigger than I thought it would be, but the screen has been so vivid/big that watching movies/tv on Metra has been great. Im happy with the GB, and love that you can add more easily. Battery is able to be taken out, its fast, and the camera is impressive. The photos come out way better than our Samsung or iPhone. I was hesitant at first but have grown to really like it. Android has been great, its very customizable, and Ive been able to find screen protectors/cases for it.
customer_reviews.author: Frankie

customer_reviews.title: Bought two phones. One of them failed.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of those phones for my parents. One of them continues to work just fine with decent quality pictures, decent sounds, and support for most apps. The second phone thought, within 1 year, started randomly switching between applications and making phone calls. It seemed to have "gohst touches" where random swipes and touches are made not by me. Phone became useless as it continues to randomly call people at least twice weekly.
customer_reviews.author: ramy.sadek

customer_reviews.title: Works on US Cellular
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband, who has US Cellular. I was worried, based off other reviews that say it doesn't work for US Cellular, despite Motorola's saying it does. It does work and is connected on their strongest network. I did have to go to 2 different techs at the USC store in order to get it worked out - the first spent 2 hours and never did get it, the 2nd got it in less than 5 minutes. There was a special code she had to put in instead of the phone's meid number (I think). At any rate, it works and my husband LOVES it.
customer_reviews.author: porcelain

customer_reviews.title: I hate this phone so much, it's hard for me to not get violent.
customer_reviews.text: I bought my Motorola MOTO to replace the $40 Walmart smart phone I had been using since it only had 4 gig of internal memory which is far too easily filled, causing it to constantly freeze up, not work properly, yada yada yada. After owning a MOTO for about 6 months now, I miss that phone. I'm struggling to think of a single thing I really like about it. The camera processor is slow. The OS is buggy. The internal modem is weak. OH!!! Here we go. The speakers are sufficiently loud. There. I found something good to say about the MOTO. Other than that, yeah, I got nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Nice phone, but it wasn't new, as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: I like this phone and it's a big improvement over older Moto Gs. However, the amount of time the phone rings for an incoming call is very short, and there doesn't seem to be any way to adjust it. The phone that I purchased was advertised as new; however I'm questioning this. Definitely the charger that came with it was used - it's all beat up. Am trying to track down the seller.
customer_reviews.author: Julie D.

customer_reviews.title: the phone worked great for the first few months but starting around month ...
customer_reviews.text: the phone worked great for the first few months but starting around month 5 im having the "ghost touch" issue. its extremely annoying. a lot of people are having this issue with the phone being plugged in but I get them all the time whether plugged in or not. you get what you pay for i guess..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love it and you may also
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a fast phone with plenty of storage and a nice camera, you will not be disappointed. I have TRACFONE service and this phone works great. It doesn't have all the fancy preloaded apps you get with a Samsung Galaxy, but it doesn't have the price tag either. Again it is fast has a nice big screen, plays my casual games, music, takes nice pictures, and even makes phone calls just fine. My only wish is that Otter box would make a case for these phones.
customer_reviews.author: B. Heembrock

customer_reviews.title: Very fast shipping, but the phone doesn't work for US Cellular
customer_reviews.text: Gave this 5 stars cause the shipping was amazing. Fastest I have ever seen. Unfortunately this phone does not work with US cellular, even though the Motorola website says that it is fully compatible and tested for them. Went all the way up the chain with US Cellular and had no luck. Had to return the phone to get one that would work. Make sure you check with your carrier prior to getting this, or any phone, cause the websites are not always accurate. Learned that the hard way.
customer_reviews.author: L2or3d

customer_reviews.title: Sure works for me.
customer_reviews.text: I've had it 4 months now and so far I could not be happier. Camera does quite well and I've used it for high resolution 266dpi print magazine, video works great, battery lasts a long time and charges quickly (I do drain it to between 10-30 percent before recharging), apps work great, I'm (KNOCK ON WOOD) not getting shuddering or phantom taps that some reviews mention and generally I'm super pleased with everything about it. .
customer_reviews.author: CF

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Buy it in June and dead by September. Was having issues from the get go and it only got worse until mic stopped working. Will not be buying anything refurbished by Amazon ever again.
customer_reviews.author: LL

customer_reviews.title: I wont recommend any product as I had Nexus 6 which has ...
customer_reviews.text: I had faced multiple issue with this phone.After couple of months,SIM slot got damaged and then they replaced it which has the problem with speaker and then the replaced it again.This time the phone started switching off automatically in every 1 hr even-though the battery was more than 80%..You can read the switch off problem with Moto phone.I wont recommend any product as I had Nexus 6 which has the same problem.
customer_reviews.author: AJEET SINGH

customer_reviews.title: I'm very happy with my Moto G Plus
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with my Moto G Plus. I debated on whether or not to update to the Plus model and am so I happy I did. The fingerprint sensor is wonderful and quick! The phone is very responsive. I was concerned about the larger size, but has not been an issue at all. I was going from IOS to Android and have not had any regrets. Very happy with my Moto phone!
customer_reviews.author: Happy Reader

customer_reviews.title: Ghost touches; unreliable
customer_reviews.text: This phone was great for about 9 months. Now it is almost useless. It is nearly impossible to unlock the screen, and there are ghost touches constantly. It will call people randomly. I really liked the phone initially, but definitely would not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good phone, features are amazing for price...
customer_reviews.text: Great price for product, only issue is that fingerprint requires pin as well, kinda making it useless, but purchased for an older person, wont use it.. Has features close to a higher end phone, like mine which is $180+ more (Does feel cheaper though, but in a case), Is unlocked, works with total wireless, 5gb data, unlimted talk/text 35m... Surprised at features for cheaper phone, camera is good enough for average user.. Happy with purchase...
customer_reviews.author: J E (NJ)

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for a couple of months
customer_reviews.text: I LOVED this phone for the first 2 months I owned. It worked seamlessly. But then after it wasn't so new it would freeze up frequently (several times a day) when watching Netflix and sending texts. I would have to turn my phone off at least daily, usually a couple times a day. Over all, not a bad phone for the price, but just know it isn't as amazing at the specs leave you to believe.
customer_reviews.author: CAT

customer_reviews.title: Poor performance
customer_reviews.text: Waste of money. This phone lasted three months and one week. Used the Verizon network, which I found performed flawlessly. The phone wouldn't accept specific apps, notably any compass apps. The device proved increasingly difficult to open and answer calls. Finally it would not shut off and after I got it to turn off, it would not, and does not to this day, turn on. However, the LiOn battery has made the phone very hot. I am off of Motorola products.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Great phone for the price
customer_reviews.text: I only need my phone to do 3 things Text, Email, and make phone calls. This phone does more and works great been very happy with it worth the price. It's unlocked, uses Vanilla android so you know it has no bloat ware from 3rd party vendors. I don't play games or use it for social media so the battery life on this phone lasts pretty much all day but your mileage may vary.
customer_reviews.author: SlimPickens

customer_reviews.title: Great phone, US Cellular will not activate
customer_reviews.text: Great phone, US Cellular will not activate! It has to be activated as moto g3 had to find an authorized retailer to do this. Awesome phone for the money. Wish I could get an OtterBox case but they don't make one for this model. That is the only drawback I've found
customer_reviews.author: Sam Carlson

customer_reviews.title: but the screen size is great, resolution is good
customer_reviews.text: Bought to replace an LG G4 that died as soon as the 1 year warranty expired.. The camera doesn't have OIS, no NFC, updates aren't as frequent as the Nexus phones, but the screen size is great, resolution is good, camera works well, fingerprint scanner works well, no bloatware.... It's an excellent deal. Would love Nougat and more frequent software updates. - updated - it's been many many months since the last update. Since being sold to Lenovo, Motorola has all but stopped software updates of any sort.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Not sure...
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this product a 3/5 stars because it DIED after ONE week of usage. The whole week it worked like a charm. Very beautiful HD screen, great pics, super fast and I've always been a fan of the google UI. I'm not giving it a 1 star because after extensive research I'm ruling it as just a faulty device; which happens more often than we would all want. I'm getting a replacement soon, and I'll update the review then.
customer_reviews.author: A. Sierralta

customer_reviews.title: Everything I had expected, but better.
customer_reviews.text: I love this phone just as I loved my old Moto g 2nd gen. I like The size and the processing died is great. The stock battery cover is easy to dent if it's dropped, but it feels nice to the touch. The screen didn't crack or scratch both times I've dropped it on accident from about hip level to concrete ground.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Kohls

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Camera, Pretty good phone.
customer_reviews.text: Camera quality is A+. UI is A+. Screen quality is a B, not fantastic and the edges are a little darker than the rest of the screen. OS is a little slow, especially after 6+ months of use would give it a B-. WiFi is spotty no matter what WiFi i'm on. will randomly drop to 4g and I don't realize, burning my data plan. Overall a pretty good phone, would recommend and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Big Red

customer_reviews.title: Providing a review after almost two years of use
customer_reviews.text: Well, the phone works well initial 1 year, but after that it starts to act weird. The battery sucks after one year, you have to charge at least twice everyday and believe me I am not a guy who plays game. I play games not more than half an hour in a week on average. The data cable they provided in the box stopped working after 1.5 years. Also, the phone switches off automatically sporadically and then again opens up, which is not at all good when you are in the middle of something.
customer_reviews.author: Salil Koner

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for $300 dollars
customer_reviews.text: Moto G4 Plus. What a Great $300 phone. It replaces a Nexus 6P 128g that died after nougat upgrade. No NFC but everything else is great. Great and accurate finger print scanner (actually prefer it on the front), good pictures, good sound, beautiful screen, perfect size at 5.5", stock Android, solid build, great battery life that lasts all day with turbo charging! I wish this phone was out before I spent $700 on a 6p.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Moto G4 is a good phone but not with Amazon specs.
customer_reviews.text: We have two Moto G 4 Plus phones, one purchased directly from Motorola the second through Amazon supposedly from Motorola. The first G4 from Motorola has been Great, comparable to my previous Samsung's but more affordable. The second ordered through Amazon we are replacing after only 8 months due to operating glitches making it nearly unusable. We have restored it to factory settings and it worked fine for a while then started acting up. After reading some other similar reviews it appears Amazon may order some Moto phones to their specific specs and that causes the problem. Am ordering a new G5 from Motorola today.
customer_reviews.author: Richard wendt

customer_reviews.title: I loved this phone for the first 10 days of usage
customer_reviews.text: I loved this phone for the first 10 days of usage. However, for the last 3 days this phone acts as if there was a ghost inside, the screen flickers on and off, the app I have open closes for no reason, my hangouts app types letters and symbols I didn't click on and it switches between apps without me having done anything. When the battery gets low these issues happen more frequently but they also happen even with a full charge. So sorry to send it back because I loved many of its features as well as the price. Oh well, back to the drawing board.
customer_reviews.author: Franquis

customer_reviews.title: Phone better value than IPhone
customer_reviews.text: My phone works well except an occasional inability to load incoming messages on a timely basis. Could be my phone plan... not certain. Battery power is good so far. I like the size of the phone and screen and the operation. Wakes up when I move it. Shows me the types of messages but not details because of the security options I selected. Occasionally the fingerprint ID doesn't work, so don't forget your passcode. Fingerprint is good in a crowd... they don't see your passcode. I bought a like-new phone and saved $20. Glad I did. Compared to an IPhone, I think based on price, this G4 Plus (aka G Plus 4th Gen.) is the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Paul O.

customer_reviews.title: Best Bang for the Buck
customer_reviews.text: I love my G4plus smartphone! Maybe I'm old school, but i refuse to sacrifice having a headphone dock and SD Storage. This phone has it all. For the price and the build, its a steal. With a screaming 8/core processor, tons of storage, 4gb/ram and Android 6 Marshmallow, it outpaces many competitive phones in far higher price brackets. Low price, long battery life and high caliber performance makes this phone my #1 (All Around Best Bang for the Buck) pick.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very glad I made this purchase
customer_reviews.text: I like a lot about this phone. I bought it to replace my S7 edge. The selfie camera is really really good. The OS is very simple and friendly feeling. The side buttons are great. The speaker is very well placed and sounds great! The fingerprint scanner is 10x better than the S7's. And it picks up wifi better than the S7 did. The phone's back camera sucks really bad in low light. The phone heats up on the back continuously and I didn't see a stock gallery app. I had to download one. The Emojies suck. They are not android or Apple but Google's. Not water proof and no removable battery but I knew that before the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Crocker

customer_reviews.title: Crashes 2-3 times per day. Gets stuck and becomes unable to reboot
customer_reviews.text: Initially, the phone Would freeze and reboot about 1 timer per week. It was not enough to be a big enough problem to return it. Now, after 2 months it crashes and gets stuck in a reboot loop 2-3 times per day. This may be the last Motorola phone that I buy. I had some trouble with the Moto G phones that I had purchased in the past but this XT1644 G4 Plus has been the most problematic by far. When buying a cheap phone you expect to take the risk of getting a piece of garbage, but I at least thought it would last me six months. Instead I am left looking for a new phone after 2 months.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Ward

customer_reviews.title: Touch Screen Failing
customer_reviews.text: Started out excellent with this phone. Now, after a few months, the touch screen is failing. Touch points come up when unlocking screen and starts whatever item it is sitting on. Extremely frustrating as I must restart the screen until it quits. I cleaned the screen and did everything I could, but to no avail. Wish I hadn't purchased this phone for that reason only.
customer_reviews.author: Darrell Janssen

customer_reviews.title: will work for 2.5 years before the screen dies...
customer_reviews.text: Pro: decent choice (price/quality) and I must say it worked correctly for 2.5 years. The only thing I regret is that the camera is a bit slow to take picture. Cons: the screen died after 2.5 years, just went black. Went to a repair shop, the guy tried everything, the screen is dead! So if you want to spend your money on a phone that last 2.5 years, it's a good pick, otherwise try something else...
customer_reviews.author: francois g.

customer_reviews.title: In 2017, a great relatively inexpensive phone
customer_reviews.text: Written in 2017. For a relatively inexpensive phone, it is very capable with 4 gb of ram and 64 gb of storage. I added a 128 gb sd card. Everything works quickly and fluidly. Large, beautiful screen. High resolution camera. Battery life is good. It has the traditional micro usb-b port, which is convenient since that's what all my cords fit. Android 6 Marshmallow is similar to past Android versions and works well. I have AT&T, and set up was quick with a new SIM card. Mobile hotspot works well.
customer_reviews.author: Anony-Mouse

customer_reviews.title: Battery sucks
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a tech person so I just wanted a phone that handles my daily apps used, phone calls & texting. I liked my previous Motorola, so I thought I'd spend a little more money this time & upgrade. My apps consist of Facebook, banking & shopping, maps & sometimes pandora or kindle. I am disappointed that the battery life is not at all what was implied when I was checking the specs on this phone. I barely make it home from my work day with battery life left. And I'm constantly trying to cool the phone off so I don't make the news with an exploding phone! Camera is just ok. Not happy with this Moto.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Hubby needed a new phone. But he is pretty careless with phones so we never spend a lot on one. This does what he needs at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Jane L.

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous appliance
customer_reviews.text: This is not a loveable device. It looks and feels so ordinary. It's easily mistaken for at least two other phones on the market. I miss the happiness my last phone gave. I miss that phones stereo speakers, especially. That said- it's a zippy, reliable telephone with a very nice display. It also feels sturdy, despite the cheap plastic surface (which I keep covered with a protective cover). Don't misplace it or it'll blend in with every other phone in a pile.
customer_reviews.author: GDKay

customer_reviews.title: Great phone for the price.
customer_reviews.text: The camera on the MOTO G 4PLUS is really great. The price is great. I bought this in 2016 and now it's 2018 and it's still going. Unfortunately, now the screen has a burn from the led lights that changes depending on the background screen, but it's very minimal. I have mine in a case and it has survived many falls. I recommend. Nowadays you don't need an 800 dollar phone. It calls, it texts, it takes great pictures. Has lots of memory and the battery lasts a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Annoying---WORST phone ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: the phone started updating immediately and it will not stop! About four months later, the phone takes on a spirit of it's on. it flickers for absolutely no reason and then when texting, characters start appearing on the screen by themselves. the only way to stop the foolery is to lock the screen and try again. i wish it had done this before the return deadline was up.
customer_reviews.author: Metris

customer_reviews.title: Interface is easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Pre-bought and is my first Android. Interface is easy to use, the transition from my other OS. Size is good, the phone is fast, responsive, and has a great capacity. The only issue I've had is when the phone is charging and in use, it gets very warm and sometimes the screen gets warm and the phone taps things on the screen. I have to turn off the phone, let it finish charging before I can use it again, or stop charging it. It happens more frequently with older chargers. Other than that, it has been wonderful. I am really enjoying it.
customer_reviews.author: Trish

customer_reviews.title: This seemed like a great phone at first - not too much ...
customer_reviews.text: This seemed like a great phone at first - not too much bloatware, beautiful display, awesome battery life, etc. etc. Less than six months after purchase, it stopped recognizing my sim card. No error message, just a message that no sim card was detected. After hours spent on the phone with my carrier and Lenovo, I sent it back for replacement under warranty. I just received my replacement today and it worked for about twenty minutes before it too stopped recognizing my sim card. Based on my reading the Lenovo forums, this is a super common issue with this phone and there's no sign of a solution.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Brown

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this phone
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this phone. Looks great, fast performance, and good battery life that has only decreased slightly since I bought it. Fantastic phone at the fraction of the price of similar phones.
customer_reviews.author: Torsten B.

customer_reviews.title: Ghost Touching Issue
customer_reviews.text: Screen ghost touching is a severe problem. You can not use adaptive screen brightness or the problem renders the phone unusable. even with brightness turned to a low level, ghost touches are a continual problem.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: giggly screen phone
customer_reviews.text: Had the phone for 5 weeks and had to ask Amazon to return it, even though the warranty was for thirty days. Kept giggling the screen making it impossible to shut off phone, and opening apps and inputing data on it's own. Only happened once in a while, so lived with it, but on the 5th week it became bad.
customer_reviews.author: Todd A.

customer_reviews.title: Over all good phone but hard time connecting to Verizon network
customer_reviews.text: Over all good phone but hard time connecting to Verizon network, Verizon told me it's a gsm phone? But it says advertised it's unlocked for any carrier? So have phone running on att but service in my area is not the best for att. Good product overall just wish it was more versatile-conveinent with using multiple carriers.
customer_reviews.author: Dwight

customer_reviews.title: Six months and still loving this phone!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this phone for six months with Straight Talk service and I still love it. I don't have one single complaint. The phone is very easy to set up and is fast and easy to use. If you want a phone without a $600.00 price tag, I highly recommend this one!
customer_reviews.author: shirlgirld

customer_reviews.title: Spin Flickers and Rolls
customer_reviews.text: This has been so upsetting. I first started this phone 2 days ago. I noticed it getting hot, very hot. Then then the screen would not register commands, then the screen began spinning. I was stunned I couldn't believe I bought this from Amazon. It continued to flicker, flash and spin for some time. I am most unhappy. I was very exited to get this phone, then it acts like this while my sons 25.00 Samsung from Walmart is working better than this one.
customer_reviews.author: Momo

customer_reviews.title: Good phone for about a year!
customer_reviews.text: A fairly decent phone for the price, no complaints until about 2 months ago it started adding letters and numbers to my texts, and apps started opening up on their own randomly. It wasn't hot or charging when it happened. I've read that this has happened to others as well. I would think one would be able to get more than 15 months out of a phone before it started glitching. Purchased in Feb. Of 2017, will be saving up for a new phone asap, this one isn't dependable!! Very dissapointed 😓
customer_reviews.author: Jules

customer_reviews.title: ... line and the first one that has been a disappointment. The camera keeps crashing at which point the ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3 phone from the moto g line and the first one that has been a disappointment. The camera keeps crashing at which point the phone needs to be restarted which is super annoying when you are trying to a moment. Even more frustrating is that when you turn off the phone to get the camera to reset IT EARASE ALL YOUR MUSIC OFF YOUR MEMORY CARD!!!! All I kind find online are article about how this is a known issue but no solutions.
customer_reviews.author: shopaholic

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: I have used Moto G and G3 in the past and this was my third Moto phone. Given a choice, I will not buy this phone again. Pros: Does the basic job and is cheap. Cons - After 6 months of use, the phone becomes slow and hangs. - The jack for the earphone is crappy and there seems to be a loose connection in it. I identified this problem too late, else I would have returned it. - While walking in the sun, the phone becomes very hot and hangs a lot. Never buying a Moto phone again.
customer_reviews.author: srinivas

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted one year
customer_reviews.text: Really loved this phone, but after about nine months of normal use the user interface kept crashing, sometimes as often as every few minutes. Then after nearly exactly one year, the speaker completely failed so no phone calls were possible without headphones, no alarms could be heard, etc. Finally, around the same time, and probably another symptom of faulty user interface, the phone stopped communicating with my sim card requiring a complete restart. Of course all of this could be because, even though I purchased a "new" product, the one I received had a passcode set, therefore not actually a new product. Beware the business you buy from. Way too much money to spend for only one year of use.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have had nothing but trouble with this phone. At first it was a great phone for the $. But after time I have had to deal with "ghost touching" problem (look it up many with this phone has had this problem)... And within the last month I have dealt with my phone shutting off regularly. I have noticed it's usually when my battery says it is 60% or less. It happens a lot when receiving a phone call or scrolling through Facebook. Wish I never bought this phone!
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Great mid grade device.
customer_reviews.text: You can't beat this device for the price. The Motorola features on top of Android are excellent and non intrusive. I love the notification peak on the lock screen and shake and twist feature for camera and flashlight. It doesn't have the speed of a flagship and the battery life isn't great but for a phone in this price range I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Mikesean

customer_reviews.title: Great Phone!
customer_reviews.text: Great phone with lots of available space to store pictures and videos and more. Item was as described. I have a contract with Verizon and I actually had to take the phone to the Verizon store to get it to work with my sim card but its all good now, the only thing that you can't access is the myverizon app, since the phone is not part of Verizons line up of phones, but other than that I am satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Jimenez

customer_reviews.title: Initial experience is very good
customer_reviews.text: I have the phone for less than a week. Very impressed with it so far. It's very responsive. Have installed about 30 apps on it with no issues. Battery life excellent. I don't stream video or audio through it, but, use it frequently for appointments, e-mail and miscellaneous app usage throughout the day. When I plug it in at night, it still has 60% battery left. For the price, very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: DUDE

customer_reviews.title: "Ghost Taps"
customer_reviews.text: I was satisfied with the phone for about a year, but for the past few months it has been getting ghost taps that have become increasingly worse. Ghost taps are when it looks like and invisible person has taken over the phone. Nonsense gets typed, apps open, settings change before my eyes, but I can not stop it or control the screen. At first I thought it was annoying but could live with it, but it happens more frequently and for longer periods of time. The phone is completely unreliable. I tried a factory reset and using it in safe mode with no improvement. I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Strolle

customer_reviews.title: A GOOD VALUE
customer_reviews.text: This Android phone is simple and easy to use plus a powerful wireless computer with all the features in very expensive comparables. At a good price point is does a few quirky things, but Motorola support is good. A good value.
customer_reviews.author: SHARK BAIT

customer_reviews.title: Don't waist your money
customer_reviews.text: Redoing my review. This is my second one. First one kept ghosting & wouldn't shut off. Did get an exchange, now this one will not always unlock as the numbers won't click. When trying to post online sometime the keyboard won't come up. Now it is starting the ghosting. I am very disappointed no in this phone. Won't buy another. I
customer_reviews.author: MrsB

customer_reviews.title: So far I am amazed
customer_reviews.text: So far I am amazed. Works as advertised. I like the size, screen, storage, battery performance, speed, newness(android 6 and beyond), fingerprint unlock performance, voice recognition performance, turbo charging, and the PRICE. Get a slimline case like the (Bear Motion Ultra Slim Back Cover Case for Moto G4 / G4 Plus) and you're good to go. People will by saying "what phone is that".
customer_reviews.author: Mike O.

customer_reviews.title: Rec'd this quickly & have had no problems whatsoever with ...
customer_reviews.text: Rec'd this quickly & have had no problems whatsoever with it. Put in a 128gb SD card for extra storage which was accepted & worked with no problem also. It is so much faster than my old LG, in every aspect. Just a pleasure to use.
customer_reviews.author: Txcdi

customer_reviews.title: Great at first.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a little iffy about the stars rating, because it is a fantastic phone. My problem is, however, that the phone randomly shuts down now. It always starts right back up, but if I'm using the phone to make a call and using another app, it shuts down. If the battery falls below 60% it shuts down...
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa Camille

customer_reviews.title: This has been a great phone for the money
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great phone for the money. My first phone from Amazon had ghost touch issues, but I opened a service request with Motorola, and they sent me a replacement phone within a week and I haven't had any issues. If I destroy this phone for some reason, I'd buy it again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Breaks easily, poor security
customer_reviews.text: After 8 months, the power button broke. The phone is still under warranty but they won’t send me a new power button, I have to navigate their repair policy which would leave me without a phone for a couple weeks, or $25 out of pocket. Not cool. (Fortunately I can buy a third party replacement, thanks Amazon!) Also bear in mind that security updates are slow and out of date. If you care about your phone’s security, Apple and Pixel phones are really the only options at the beginning of 2018.
customer_reviews.author: Utah Piano

customer_reviews.title: Decent phone but questionable build and material quality. My ...
customer_reviews.text: Decent phone but questionable build and material quality. My first G4 developed a hardware problem with micro usb connector, computer would not recognize it. Got a replacement. In couple of month new phone developed a hardware problem with headphone jack and hairline crack in the screen. Phone was never dropped and always kept in a cover.
customer_reviews.author: amzn_shopper

customer_reviews.title: I loved this phone so much even the features I thought ...
customer_reviews.text: I loved this phone so much even the features I thought were useless ended up being amazing- my personal favorite was the motion to turn on flashlight. I'm so sad to say that just over a year of use it froze up and bricked. This would usually be less stars but I really did love this phone.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Rahne

customer_reviews.title: Reasonable price but not great performance.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this phone since February. I brought this looking its great specs with less price. Initially I liked this phone but now I have been noticing many lags in this device. This phone has 4 gb of RAM but while using games like Clash Royale,the phone stops functioning. There is hotspot sharing problem. Hotspot doesn't start. This phone starts heating using camera for 5 to 10 minutes and also while playing games for short period of time.
customer_reviews.author: Mahesh

customer_reviews.title: Worst mistake I have made
customer_reviews.text: Worst mistake I have made. The problem started with the phone always heating up. Later it goes off spontaneously even when it is charged. I even had to buy the phone for my wife because of the picture quality of the phone but hers has started having the same problem. Right now mine automatically goes off whenever the battery drops to 90 percent charged. Am about buying another phone after barely 6months of using this damn phone. Bad choice I think. Nothing personal, it's just my experience with the phone.
customer_reviews.author: amy

customer_reviews.title: Ghost touching - apparently a common issue.
customer_reviews.text: Lasted 9 months and then screen glitched so bad I had to replace. Don't buy this phone without a warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Luci Faucher

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this phone; STOPPED DETECTING SIM CARD in two months
customer_reviews.text: I have given this phone one star just because its appearance. Try not to buy this phone. I bought this phone in February and in the month of April this phone STOPPED DETECTING SIM CARD! There was no physical damage to the phone and it was handled carefully. I thought that was only my phone's issue but when I checked online there are many users complaining about the same problem. This a huge disappointment that a phone cannot do its basic task. I tried to do factory reset,starting in safe mode but still it did not detect my sim. I am returning this phone. Hopefully motorola/lenovo return my money. Worst experience ever!
customer_reviews.author: teja

customer_reviews.title: Phone died when warranty expired!
customer_reviews.text: This was an awesome phone for the first year, then, as soon as the warranty had expired, it just randomly started shutting down, usually while using google maps to navigate, or during an important phone call! This was my 2nd Motorola phone. Something similar happened to the previous one, a Droid Razor. I will NEVER buy Motorola again.
customer_reviews.author: Dianne B.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome phone and you can't beat the price for an ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome phone and you can't beat the price for an unlocked phone. Performance is as good as my Iphone 6. Camera works great in daylight situations but could be better when there is not much light.
customer_reviews.author: James Cook

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy refurbished
customer_reviews.text: It worked for 5 days then shut off and won't turn on even with a hard boot.. I can't wipe my data off so I can't return it knowing my information is still on it
customer_reviews.author: Dawhiteman

customer_reviews.title: Great Phone.
customer_reviews.text: The phone works great. There was a small problem as the SIM card did not fit snug in the phone so I would lose connection from time to time. I put some tape on top of the SIM card so that it fit snug in the phone and works great.
customer_reviews.author: Raj Chanani

customer_reviews.title: A good compromise, but not optimal
customer_reviews.text: Very Good value for the money, generally, with 64GB of memory and decent, not great, battery life. "Turbo charger", which very speedily recharges phone, compensates somewhat for typical smartphone battery life. Very surprised and disappointed by lack of accelerometer necessary to use Google Sky, one of my favorite apps.
customer_reviews.author: Mark My Words

customer_reviews.title: Hate this phone
customer_reviews.text: Purchased phone in November and in April started the ghost touch. At first it was a letter here or there, open an app or make a call. I just figured I had a dirty screen. Now if I use it, I'd have to power it down 5 times a day, it's that bad.
customer_reviews.author: Rich R.

customer_reviews.title: The worst phone in history
customer_reviews.text: The worst phone in history, Lenovo ruin motorola. At first the screen crazed, I have to use it in less than 10% brightness to make it work. A few months of use began to go off when playing videos or audios, now it goes off all the time. I can not answer calls, I can not watch videos, I can not do anything with this phone. I want to return it but I have no answers from the technical service of Motorola or Amazon. It's a lie about the one-year warranty. Do not buy it and do not buy anything from LENOVO. Look for reviews on the internet, the device has many flaws.
customer_reviews.author: Florencia Meza Liotti

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Best phone for the price by far. I added a 64 gig card and now i have 128 gigs. plus it has 4 gigs of ram very handy.. FYI i have had this phone for a while and still love it. best camera i have had finger print reader is awesome turbo charger charges super fast battery last long time
customer_reviews.author: Walter

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this phone to replace a defective phone by another popular brand that I bought earlier this year. I had the phone for a little over 3 months and it quit charging. The USB charger was working fine so the problem was with the phone. I am so frustrated. I had to return to using my old Samsung phone that served me without a single flaw for 2 years and decided to keep as a back-up.
customer_reviews.author: AH
